medical_history.chief_complaint: Ruptured appendicitis with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced 4 days of nausea and vomiting, which he attributed to jet lag or a 'GI bug.' He developed right lower quadrant pain one day ago, which was persistent. Symptoms of profuse sweating were noted today, and he reported mild anorexia with reduced nausea. He also mentioned some urinary frequency but denied other urinary symptoms.
